polls.question: Is ZeroMe as good as it was hyped up to be?
Should ZeroNet re-enable cross-origin requests, or include some other method of accessing content from other sites?
polls.answers: Yes, reenable cross-origin requests--|--Yes, include a cross-site request call to the zeronet api--|--Yes, include a new api call as well as reenable cross-origin requests--|--No, sites should be completely isolated

polls.question: Did you get the covid vax?

comments.body: Back to the future trilogy is awful. The best of the three is clearly the second one, since it at least *tries* to make some rational sense. But they're still easily some of the worst time travel movies.

Yea, it's a fun concept. And arguably excused of awful time travel since there doesn't seem to be many time travel movies of the same age that do it right. And, if you can ignore the blatant disrespect of time travel, they can even be fun movies. It's just the disappearing hand trope has wrecked them for me. The second one tends to avoid this the most, and veers off into a multiple timeline kinda deal. It's also the only one that involves the future, which is cool.

And yea, comments are working fine :)
Why not have an option for random ordering? Have it ordered as entered by default, but if enabled it'll shuffle the order?
I just like Nintendo :P. Can't play Splatoon or the new Zelda games on a PC, PS4, or XBOne.

@nippletwister, for a P2P youtube, something like webtorrent could be used. Have uploaded videos create a new torrent/magnet link, and then have the site use web torrent to stream the content. Would work well I think. Only catch is that videos would need people to constantly seed it. Hmm...
Really needs a ZeroWiki.bit domain or something...

Call me a pessimist, but I picked 'not to be'. Personally, I picked it because I see 'be' and 'not to be' as ways of thinking. Someone who 'be's something inherently limits themselves. Or rather, am/am not. Someone might avoid programming because "I'm not good with computers." Nonsense. You're not good with computers because you didn't bother to learn or practice. Not that you simply aren't cut out for it.

Likewise, identity talk like that can lead to people *not wanting* to branch out. And feel some sort of weird forcing of having to do or make certain things. "I'm a gamer, so I have to keep playing games."

I find that when you eliminate this way of thinking, you start to branch off and look into a bunch of cool stuff. So forget whether your are or aren't something. Whether you aspire to be a particular thing. Just do what you like, do what you think looks cool. Even if you think that's not you. 'not to be' is the way to be :D

Trump is definitely gonna be the Republican nominee. And the Democrat nominee is likely going to be Hillary, but Sanders might make it. In either case it looks to me like Trump would win. If it's Trump v Bernie, I think Trump has more supporters. If it's Trump v Hillary, a lot of former Bernie supporters will go Trump. All three TBH kinda suck. But I'd much prefer Sanders to win, even if I think he doesn't have that much of a shot.

Censorship is always bad. There's no valid argument for policing speech and thought.

>Most people do agree that underage porn for example should be censored. 

I don't think so. I'm pretty sure most people agree that underage minors unable to make decisions and enter legal contracts should not be exploited. AFAIK no one has an issue with stuff like loli hentai. This view also breaks down once you divorce duration of life from physical and mental age.

> censorship of speech is good (insults and things like that) 

This is probably the worst use of censorship. Insults will always exist, even if you ban using the words. New words will simply pop up in their place. On top of that, insults aren't problematic in the slightest.

> Some opinions are deemed bad by a government or a company

This. If you have the ability to censor content, you have an authority that has the *power* to censor content. Meaning that there's an imbalance of free speech. One agent (the government/company/etc) has more power over the other. This is bad. And can lead to thought policing of even good ideas (such as avoiding censorship :P). One should not be punished for bringing up new ideas. Look at any religion to see how that turns out.

>On the other hand, trolls abuse the right to freely speak your mind, they will try to destroy a community.

If a community is destroyed by allowing people to freely speak, it must not have been a good community to begin with. There *is* something to be said about spam drowning out legitimate content and speech. But that's essentially censorship through volume, rather than removing the offending content.

>I hope these new decentralized networks like ZeroNet will let us try and find out to see if the current model of censoring speech is good or if there is something that is much better for society.

Decentralized networks and communities allow people to speak uncensored. Those who wish to artificially limit what they hear or say can do so. Those who want completely free speech regardless of hate/spam/etc can also do so.
Your padding is off. Read as actual binary and it'd just be gibberish.

I don't use cloud storage in general. I don't like having my data on someone else's servers, and I don't like the requirement of having internet to access them. And for popular stuff like dropbox, it takes up precious HDD space.

Though, I *do* have some stuff on my google drive (just some text documents). And I've used dropbox before for group projects. But generally I avoid them when possible.

I joined back in March. Literally my first blog post was on March 1st. I stayed until around april-ish, and then didn't pay much attention for a while until I got back into it towards the end of July. That puts me at about 5-months of knowing about and using ZeroNet.
Capitalism is a scam. It structurally does not work and requires violence to keep going. Anyone who is under capitalism is not free. Anything with a monetary system cannot be trusted.
